He has served as the Vice President of the board of the European Rental Association from 2013 to 2016 and as President from 2016 to 2022. He also served as a member of the supervisory board of Joh. Mourik & Co. Holding B.V.from 2012 to 2020.

Subsubsection Title: Lilian Boels-Van Kerkom joined the Group in July 1987 and was appointed as a statutory director of the Issuer
Subsubsection Text: in July 2018. She currently holds an advisory role regarding legal matters, sales and operations and contract management. Lilian joined the company at an early stage of its development and has played an instrumental role in its growth, developing the various divisions she had worked in. She started her career in the Group as a commercial team leader for machine and party rental before creating the account receivables and insurance department in 1992 and the legal department in 2001. Her wide experience and knowledge of our company is critical in guiding the development of front-line operations and constructing the framework for rental transactions. She also advises on a wide variety topics given her deep institutional knowledge. She graduated from HEAO Sittard in 1987.

Subsubsection Title: Jan Piet Valk was appointed as Chief Financial Officer for the Group in April 2020 and was appointed as a
Subsubsection Text: statutory director of the Issuer in September 2020. During his 35 years working in finance, he has served in various finance and general management positions at several multi-national companies, including SHELL, with a focus on M&A and corporate finance. He has experience working across multiple jurisdictions for multinational companies as well as the Royal Netherlands Airforce. Prior to joining our Group, he worked at Teleplan International NV, starting as the CFO upon its acquisition by Gilde Buy Out Partners, and becoming first, President of the North American Region, based in Dallas, Texas, and then, acting CEO until the company's acquisition by Clover Wireless in 2019, when the company was divested under his leadership. He holds a masters degree in economics from Vrije University in Amsterdam. We also maintain an external advisory board consisting of a group of experienced entrepreneurs and investors which advises the Management Board on policy matters and the general course of affairs of the Group.

Subsubsection Title: Reiant Mulder joined the Boels Rental Group in October 2018, and is the Chief Operating Officer Central Europe.
Subsubsection Text: Before joining the Boels Rental Group, he was the Chief Executive Officer of Randstad Netherlands and Chief Information Officer of Randstad Groep Nederland from September 2014 to September 2018. Prior to that, he was the Operational Director for Randstad Professionals, Randstad Recruitment Solutions, Randstad Search & Selection and managed the central delivery of key accounts for Randstad Nederland from September 2010 to September 2014. From July 2008 to November 2012, he was the Managing Director of i-Bridge B.V. (ICT Shared Service Center Randstad Groep Nederlands). He holds a master's in Business Administration from Erasmus University Rotterdam.

Subsubsection Title: Guy Cremer joined the Group in November 1989 and has been the Chief Procurement Officer since August 2022
Subsubsection Text: and is responsible for the development of our rental fleet and related services. Since starting at Boels, he has served in various operational and strategic management positions. Throughout his career at Boels, his responsibilities included setting up new business models such as the DIY- rental division and advising on all M&A transactions. From his professional experience, he has developed expertise regarding growth in various products and customer segments. Outside his work for the Group, he has held various roles at the ERA since 2006 and won the ERA's Rental Person of the Year award in 2023, acknowledging his experience, market knowledge and service to the rental industry. Throughout his career he has completed coursework in leadership skills, strategic negotiations, quality management and strategic management from ISBW (Instituut voor Sociale en Bedrijfswetenschappen) and NEVI (Nederlandse Vereniging voor _Inkoopmanagement)._

Subsubsection Title: Martin Holmgren joined the Boels Group in January 2020, around the time of the Cramo acquisition. He has been
Subsubsection Text: the Chief Operating Officer Nordics since August 2020 and oversees the day-to-day management in the Nordic and Baltic markets. Before joining the Boels Group, he worked at Cramo from 2003 and was the Executive Vice President of Cramo Group Fleet Management from 2009 to 2020 and the Executive Vice President of IT and Digital from 2018 to 2020. He holds a bachelor's degree in Business Administration and Marketing from Karlstad University. As of 2022, he is a member of the board of the ERA, representing rental companies and national associations from across Europe. We also maintain an operations board, consisting of the chief operating officer, managing directors of the business units or country operational entities and the staff managers of the Finance, HSE and HR departments, which oversees the day-to-day operations of the business.

The Issuer's Strategic Board is responsible for the day-to-day management of the business. The Strategic Board consists of the members of the Management Board together with other members of our senior management. The following table sets out the names, ages and positions of the current members of the Strategic Board:

Pursuant to the application of the Dutch structural regime (structuurregime) as referred to in Section 264 of Book 2 of the Dutch Civil Code and subject to the Issuer having satisfied the requirements as referred to in Section 264 of Book 2 of the Dutch Civil Code for three consecutive years, the Issuer is required to implement a two-tier board system in 2025 and has started the search for a Supervisory Board. The Supervisory Board will supervise the general course of affairs in the company and the businesses affiliated with the company. It will also supervise the functioning of the Management Board as such and the policy conducted, and will provide the Management Board with advice.
For the year ended December 31, 2022, the aggregate compensation paid to our Statutory Board was €1.5 million (2021: €1.2 million; 2020: €1.0 million). -----

Subsection Title: SHAREHOLDERS AND RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS Shareholders
Subsubsection Text: As of the date of this Offering Memorandum, P.B.K. NV, a public limited company (naamloze _vennootschap/société anonyme)) organized and existing under the laws of Belgium having its statutory seat at Javanastraat_ 38, 3680 Maaseik, Belgium and registered with the Crossroads Bank for Enterprises (Kruispuntbank van _Ondernemingen/Banque-Carrefour des Entreprises) under number 0459.002.515 (Business Court of Antwerp, division_ Tongeren) (the "Parent"), owned 100% of our share capital. The Parent is wholly owned by our CEO, Mr. Pierre Boels Jr., and his wife, Lilian Boels-Van Kerkom.

As of June 30, 2023, we had €9.8 million in outstanding balances with related parties relating to a receivable arising from a sale and lease back transaction which was pending as at that date. For additional information, see note 4.6 to the HY 2023 Interim Financial Statements. As of June 30, 2023, we had a debt to a related party of €3.6 million. Other than those balances set out above, all other outstanding balances with related parties shown in our Annual Financial Statements have been settled. See note 26 to the FY 2022 Financial Statements.

As of January 1, 2022,the Issuer entered into a management agreement with the Parent, pursuant to which the Parent provides certain strategic, organizational, research and administrative assistance, as well as analysis on business development opportunities, and financial and legal advice. With the same effective date, Boels Verhuur NV entered into a director's agreement with the Parent, pursuant to which the Parent executes the daily operational management and provides certain strategic organizational and administrative assistance. For the year ended December 31, 2022 and the six months ended June 30, 2023, we were invoiced €123 thousand and €62 thousand under these contracts, respectively.

We are party to several real estate lease agreements with related parties and may in the future engage in similar transactions. In the years ended December 31, 2020, 2021 and 2022 and the six months ended June 30, 2023, we incurred real estate lease expenses relating to these properties of €152 thousand, €187 thousand, €357 thousand and €627 thousand, respectively.

In March 2023, we distributed €13 million in dividends to the Parent, comprised of a €6.8 million cash dividend, with the remainder settled with the outstanding receivables from related parties. See note 4.3 to the HY 2023 Interim Financial Statements. See "Management" above for details of remuneration paid to the Management Board. -----

In the course of our ordinary business activities, we enter into related party transactions with our shareholders, key management personnel and associates. We believe that all transactions with such parties are negotiated and executed on an arms-length basis and that the terms of these transactions are comparable to those currently contracted with unrelated third-parties. See note 26 to the FY 2022 Financial Statements.

_The statements in this section include, inter alia, projections and objectives in respect of our financial results, as well as statements with respect to our strategic goals and objectives. Although we believe that the expectations reflected in such forward-looking statements are reasonable, we do not provide any assurance with respect to such statements. The preparation of statements included under this section is based upon, inter alia, certain assumptions concerning future events and management actions and such events and actions may not actually be realized. You should not place undue reliance on the projections and objectives, which speak only as of the date that they were made. We do not undertake any obligation to update such forward-looking statements after the date hereof to reflect later events or circumstances or to reflect the occurrence of unanticipated events. See also "Forward-Looking Statements" and "Risk Factors."_

Boels Topholding B.V. as original borrower, original guarantor and company (the “Company”) is party to an originally up to €1,788,000,000 senior facilities agreement (subsequently reduced to €1,629,300,000) originally dated November 10, 2019 (as amended and restated from time to time including, most recently by the amendment and restatement agreement dated June 15, 2021, the “Senior Facilities Agreement”) providing for a revolving credit facility in an aggregate amount of €179,300,000 (the “Revolving Credit Facility”) and a term loan facility in a principal aggregate amount of €1,450,000,000 (“Facility B”) (the Revolving Credit Facility and Facility B are collectively referred to as the “Senior

Subsection Title: Facilities” for the purposes of this description).
Subsubsection Text: Under the Revolving Credit Facility, a lender (or an affiliate of a lender) may make available an ancillary facility by way of an overdraft facility, a guarantee, bonding, documentary or stand-by letter of credit facility, a short term loan facility, a derivatives facility, a foreign exchange facility, or any other facility or accommodation which is agreed by the Company and the relevant ancillary lender, to a borrower in place of all or part of the respective lender’s unutilized Revolving Credit Facility commitment. -----

Subsection Title: Facilities” for the purposes of this description).
Subsubsection Text: The Senior Facilities bear interest at a rate of EURIBOR plus the applicable margin. The margin applicable to the Senior Facilities is adjusted from time to time, subject to certain conditions (including but not limited to, if an event of default under certain clauses has occurred and is continuing, the highest margin being payable) to a percentage rate per annum determined in accordance with a Senior Secured Net Leverage related margin grid, such Senior Secured Net Leverage as calculated and certified in each quarterly compliance certificate which is required to be delivered to the Agent. If EURIBOR is less than zero, EURIBOR shall be deemed to be zero in respect of any loan made under the Senior Facilities Agreement. Default interest is 1.00% per annum higher than the interest rate that would otherwise be applicable in respect of the unpaid amount. We are required to pay quarterly in arrears a commitment fee on the available but undrawn commitments under the Revolving Credit Facility at a rate of 35% of the then applicable margin for the period commencing on the Closing Date (February 6, 2020) and ending on the last day of the availability period applicable to the Revolving Credit Facility (July 6, 2026) being the date falling one month prior to the termination date applicable to the Revolving Credit Facility (or, if earlier, the date on which the Revolving Credit Facility is cancelled in full). We are not required to pay any commitment fees to a lender for so long as it is a defaulting lender. We are also required to pay certain fees to the facility agent and the security agent in connection with the Senior Facilities Agreement.

Subsection Title: Facilities” for the purposes of this description).
Subsubsection Text: The Senior Facilities Agreement is guaranteed by the Company, and certain other members of the Group (as defined below) and is secured by the same Collateral that will secure the Notes and the Notes Guarantees, in each case subject to certain limitations due to applicable corporate law and contractual provisions. In addition, the Senior Facilities Agreement currently benefits from residual pledges over the share capital of certain non-material subsidiaries in Austria, Poland, Italy and the Czech Republic, and security over certain bank accounts and certain intercompany receivables of said non-material subsidiary in the Czech Republic, that previously guaranteed the Senior Facilities Agreement, that will not secure the Notes. The Issuer may seek majority lender consent pursuant to the terms of the Existing Senior Facilities Agreement to release such security at a future date. The Senior Facilities Agreement further provides that the aggregate of earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortization of the Company and all other guarantors with positive EBITDA (calculated on the same basis as EBITDA (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement), before reallocation of intra-group items, in each case evidenced on the basis of the latest audited consolidated financial statements of the Company and its subsidiaries (in this description of the Senior Facilities Agreement, will be referred to as the “Group”)) must represent at least 80% of the aggregate EBITDA (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) of the Group (before reallocation of intra-group items) determined annually on the basis of the audited consolidated annual financial statements of the Group but in each case excluding any members of the Group incorporated in an Excluded Jurisdiction (as defined below) and members of the Group with negative EBITDA (the “Guarantor Coverage Test”). No breach of the Guarantor Coverage Test will occur if within the agreed accession period, the Company procures that, subject to certain agreed security principles, additional members of the Group become guarantors under the Senior Facilities Agreement such that if they had been guarantors under the Senior Facilities Agreement on the reference date, the Guarantor Coverage Test would have been satisfied. The Guarantor Coverage Test will be tested annually as per the end of each financial year of the Company. The agreed accession period is 120 days and commences with the earlier of (i) receipt by the agent of the relevant annual financial statements and (ii) the date on which the annual financial statements are due to be delivered. Additionally, the Company must procure that each member of the Group which becomes, or any company acquired by a member of the Group which is, a Material Company (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) becomes a guarantor under the Senior Facilities Agreement and grants security as soon as reasonably practicable and in any event within 120 days of such company becoming a Material Company, or, as the case may be, being acquired. “Excluded Jurisdiction” means Russia, Ukraine or any (other) Sanctioned Country (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement).

Subsection Title: Facilities” for the purposes of this description).
Subsubsection Title: Voluntary cancellation and prepayment and mandatory prepayment
Subsubsection Text: The Company may, if it gives the facility agent at least five business days prior written notice, cancel the whole or, subject to a certain minimum cancellation amount, part of an available facility under the Senior Facilities Agreement. Any such cancellation will reduce the commitments of the lenders under the affected facility ratably. ----- Each borrower may voluntarily prepay all or, subject to a certain minimum repayment amount, part of a utilization made available to it under the facilities under the Senior Facilities Agreement by giving at least three business days prior notice to the facility agent. Amounts prepaid in respect of Facility B under the Senior Facilities Agreement may not be reborrowed as the relevant commitments will be irrevocably cancelled. Any prepayment shall be made with accrued interest on the amount prepaid and, subject to breakage costs, without premium or penalty. Any such prepayment will be shared pro rata across the lenders under the affected facility under the Senior Facilities Agreement. In addition to voluntary prepayments, the Senior Facilities Agreement requires mandatory prepayment and cancellation of the Senior Facilities: - with respect to any lender, if it becomes unlawful in any applicable jurisdiction for such lender to perform any of its obligations, or to fund, issue or maintain its participation in any loan made available, under the Senior Facilities Agreement (or it becomes unlawful for any affiliate of a lender for that lender to do so); and - if a Change of Control or Sale (each as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) has occurred, with respect to any lender that requires prepayment within a 30-business day offer period commencing on the earlier of (i) the Company notifying the Agent of the event and (ii) the date on which the Lender becomes aware of the event. Subject to the timely exercise of its rights within such offer period, each lender will be entitled to require each borrower to repay such lender’s participation in any utilizations to that borrower together with accrued and unpaid interest and any additional amounts accrued under the finance documents. Following the election of any lender to have its participation in any utilizations prepaid and cancelled following a Change of Control or Sale, the facility agent shall by not less than 30 days’ notice to the Company cancel the commitments of that lender and declare the participation of that lender in all outstanding utilizations, together with accrued interest and all other amounts accrued under the finance documents to that lender, immediately due and payable. Subject to the provisions of the Intercreditor Agreement (where applicable), the Company must further ensure that the borrowers prepay loans and cancel available commitments in amounts equal to the applicable percentage (determined based on the Senior Secured Net Leverage) of certain disposal proceeds, listing process and excess cashflow to the extent applicable and subject to further conditions.

Subsection Title: Facilities” for the purposes of this description).
Subsubsection Text: In respect of each quarter date, the Company is required to confirm whether or not the Total Net Leverage (each as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) for the period of the most recent four consecutive financial quarters (subject to certain provisions and adjustments) exceeds 6.58:1 (the “Financial Covenant”). A breach of the Financial Covenant will be deemed cured if it is complied with when tested on the next quarter date and no notice of acceleration has been provided to the Company under the Senior Facilities Agreement in respect of that breach of the Financial Covenant prior to such quarter date. The Company is permitted to prevent or cure breaches of the Financial Covenant by electing to designate the proceeds from any new equity of the Company and new shareholder loans received by the Company as a cure amount. The Company may not make such election (i) more than four times during the life of the Senior Facilities Agreement (of which no more than two times may be EBITDA cures), or (ii) in consecutive testing periods. Moreover, in each period of four consecutive quarters there must be at least two quarters without a cure. A breach of the Financial Covenant may only be cured if the relevant equity or shareholder loan is actually received by the Company no later than twenty (20) Business Days after the date on which the relevant compliance certificate disclosing the breach was required to be delivered to the facility agent.

Subsection Title: Facilities” for the purposes of this description).
Subsubsection Text: The Senior Facilities Agreement contains certain representations and warranties (subject to certain specified exceptions and qualifications and with certain representations being repeated), including (i) status, (ii) binding obligations, (iii) non-conflict with other obligations, (iv) power and authority, (v) validity and admissibility in evidence, (vi) governing law and enforcement, (vii) insolvency, (viii) no filings or stamp taxes, (ix) no deduction of tax, (x) no default, (xi) no breach of laws (xii) no misleading information in relation to certain information and documents provided to the facility agent and the other finance parties, (xiii) financial statements, (xiv) no proceedings pending or threatened, (xv) compliance with environmental laws, (xvi) taxation, (xvii) tax residence (xviii) ranking, (xix) good title to assets, (xx) legal and beneficial ownership of shares and assets subject to the security, (xxi) ownership of shares in material members of the group, (xxii) ----- accounting reference date (xxiii) intellectual property, (xxiv) group structure chart, (xxv) acquisition documents, (xxvi) centre of main interests and establishments, (xxvii) holding companies, (xxviii) sanctions and (xxix) anti-corruption laws. Certain representations were made on the date of the Senior Facilities Agreement and on the Closing Date. Certain representations will be repeated on the date of each utilization request, and on the first day of each interest period.

Subsection Title: Facilities” for the purposes of this description).
Subsubsection Text: We are subject to certain restrictive and, as the case may be, affirmative covenants under the Senior Facilities Agreement customary for these types of financing, which, in turn, are subject to certain specified exceptions and qualifications (customized to our business and adjusted to our current credit standing). The Senior Facilities Agreement will, in particular and without limitation, include restrictions and limitations (subject to exceptions, baskets and thresholds) on: - Mergers, amalgamations, demergers, consolidations or other corporate reorganisations; - Acquisitions and joint ventures; - Disposals; - Change of business; - Granting of security interests (negative pledge); - Making loans or extending credit; - Providing guarantees or indemnities; - Distributions, share redemption and payments on shareholder loans; - Financial indebtedness; and - Share capital.

Subsection Title: Facilities” for the purposes of this description).
Subsubsection Text: The Senior Facilities Agreement contains certain events of default that are customary for such types of financing (subject to customary materiality qualifications and grace periods), including, without limitation: (i) non-payment of amounts due under the Senior Facilities Agreement and the other finance documents, (ii) breach of the Financial Covenant, (iii) breach of other obligations, (iv) misrepresentations, (v) cross default or cross acceleration, (vi) insolvency or insolvency proceedings, (vii) creditor’s process, (viii) minimum share capital requirements of Italian obligors, (ix) unlawfulness and invalidity, (x) repudiation and rescission of agreements, (xi) breach of the Intercreditor Agreement, (xii) cessation of business, (xiii) audit qualification, (xiv) judgment, (xv) litigation, (xvi) expropriation and (xvii) occurrence of a material adverse change. The occurrence of any such event of default would, subject to any applicable grace periods or cure rights and agreed exceptions, entitle the facility agent (and the facility agent must do so if so directed by the Majority Lenders) by notice to the Company to (among other things): cancel their commitments, declare that all or part of the loans together with accrued interest and all other amounts accrued or outstanding under the finance documents be immediately due and payable and declare that all or any part of the amounts (including cash cover in respect of any outstanding amounts under the ancillary facilities) is immediately due and payable or payable on demand.

Subsection Title: Facilities” for the purposes of this description).
Subsubsection Text: The Senior Facilities Agreement and any non-contractual obligations arising out of or in connection with it are governed by English law.

Subsection Title: Facilities” for the purposes of this description).
Subsubsection Text: Facility B was fully drawn prior to the issue date and must be repaid in full on the termination date, being February 6, 2027. The Revolving Credit Facility may be drawn by the Company and any additional borrowers which may accede to the Senior Facilities Agreement subject to the conditions set out therein from February 6, 2020 (the “Closing Date”) up to and including the date falling one month prior to the termination date. The Revolving Credit Facility will mature on the date falling six years and six months after the Closing Date, being on or around August 6, 2026. The purpose of the Revolving Credit Facility is to finance general corporate and working capital purposes of the Group including, without limitation, financing permitted acquisitions and permitted joint ventures, financing distributions and dividends which are permitted subject to compliance with a leverage ratio test and financing restructuring costs. The Revolving Credit Facility may be used for the drawing of loans in euro, or by way of ancillary facilities (in any other currency as agreed between the relevant ancillary lender and the Company) by the relevant lenders thereunder or an affiliate of such lenders. Any loan made available under the Revolving Credit Facility shall (subject to the operation of customary rollover mechanics) be repaid on the last day of its interest period and all amounts outstanding under the Revolving Credit Facility must be repaid on the termination date applicable to the Revolving Credit Facility. In addition to the Revolving Credit Facility and Facility B, the Senior Facilities Agreement includes (in addition to other permissions under the limitation on indebtedness covenant) the ability to incur additional indebtedness (including under one or more uncommitted additional facilities within the Senior Facilities Agreement and/or any additional notes and/or other facilities or notes documented outside the Senior Facilities Agreement), provided that certain conditions are met including (a) a €25,000,000 minimum amount for uncommitted facility commitments and (b) a pro forma incurrence cap equal to the aggregate of: (i) the greater of (A) €205,400,000 and (B) an amount equal to 50 per cent. of Adjusted EBITDA preceding the date of incurrence (after giving pro forma effect to the relevant transaction); plus (ii) an unlimited amount at any time, where (A) Senior Secured Net Leverage (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) would not exceed 3.54:1 where the relevant Financial Indebtedness (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) constitutes Senior Facility Liabilities (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) or (B) in respect of Financial Indebtedness that does not constitute Senior Facility Liabilities and, (I) is unsecured, Fixed Charge Cover (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) would not be less than 2.00:1; and (II) is secured by Permitted Security (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) on a junior-ranking basis on assets which are also encumbered by Transaction Security securing Senior Facility Liabilities on a senior-ranking basis; and/or encumbering assets which are not subject to Transaction Security, Total Net Leverage (as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement) would not exceed 4.83:1 or (C) solely in respect of acquisition indebtedness (and including any available but undrawn commitments thereof), (I) Senior Secured Net Leverage (in respect of Financial Indebtedness constituting Senior Facility Liabilities); or (II) Total Net Leverage and Fixed Charge Cover (in respect of other Financial Indebtedness), would not be increased or decreased (as applicable) (each as defined in the Senior Facilities Agreement), plus (iii) other than to the extent funded by long term financial indebtedness, the amount equal to certain voluntary prepayments, permanent cancellations and repurchases by a member of the Group of the facilities incurred under the Senior Facilities Agreement which constitutes a permitted debt purchase transaction thereunder, other permitted facilities or notes incurred which are documented outside the Senior Facilities Agreement, together with all voluntary prepayments of the revolving facilities incurred under the Senior Facilities Agreement to the extent accompanied by a permanent reduction in the corresponding commitments.

To establish the relative rights of certain of the Group’s creditors under the Group’s financing arrangements, the Trustee and certain other parties will accede on or before the Issue Date to an intercreditor agreement (the “Intercreditor

Subsection Title: Agreement”) originally entered into between the Security Agent, the senior agent, the lenders under the Existing Senior
Subsubsection Text: The Intercreditor Agreement, inter alia, sets out: - the relative ranking of certain indebtedness and liabilities of the Debtors; - when payments can be made in respect of certain indebtedness of the Debtors; - when enforcement actions can be taken in respect of that indebtedness; - the terms pursuant to which certain indebtedness will be subordinated; - when enforcement actions can be taken in respect of the transaction security; - turnover provisions; - the order for applying proceeds from enforcement action and other amounts received by the Security Agent; and - when the transaction security and guarantees will be released to permit a disposal of the collateral. For purposes of this description, “Senior Notes” shall include the Notes and any other notes, securities or other debt instruments issued or to be issued which are designated by the Issuer as “Senior Notes” under the Intercreditor Agreement. In this description, terms used but not defined herein shall have the meaning ascribed to them in the Intercreditor Agreement.

Subsection Title: Agreement”) originally entered into between the Security Agent, the senior agent, the lenders under the Existing Senior
Subsubsection Text: Subject to certain exceptions, the Intercreditor Agreement provides that the liabilities owed by the Issuer and each other member of the Group that accedes to the Intercreditor Agreement from time to time as a debtor under the Intercreditor Agreement (together, the “Debtors”) and each Third Party Security Provider to the following parties shall rank in right and priority of payment in the following order and are postponed and subordinated to any prior ranking Liabilities as follows: _first, (i) the agents, the arrangers, the lenders, the issuing banks, the ancillary lenders and the security agent each_ in its capacity as creditor or as applicable creditor in respect of the parallel debt obligations in relation to liabilities under the Existing Senior Facilities Agreement or any other Senior Finance Document (together, the “Senior Facility

Subsection Title: Agreement”) originally entered into between the Security Agent, the senior agent, the lenders under the Existing Senior
Subsubsection Text: Facilities Agreement and others. The Intercreditor Agreement governs, inter alia, the relationships and relative priorities among (i) the creditors and arrangers under the Existing Senior Facilities Agreement; (ii) the holders of the Notes and the ----- Trustee; (iii) existing and future hedge counterparties under certain hedging agreements (the “Hedge Counterparties”); (iv) certain shareholder loan creditors, third party security providers, intra-group lenders and debtors; (v) certain other future creditors of the Group and/or such creditors representatives that may accede to the Intercreditor Agreement from time to time in accordance with its terms; and (vi) the Security Agent. By accepting a Note, holders of the Notes will be deemed to have agreed to, and accepted the terms and conditions of, the Intercreditor Agreement. The following description of certain provisions of the Intercreditor Agreement summarizes certain provisions of the Intercreditor Agreement. It does not restate the Intercreditor Agreement in its entirety nor does it describe provisions relating to the rights and obligations of holders of other classes of our debt. As such, we urge you to read the Intercreditor Agreement because it, and not the general overview that follows, defines the rights of the holders of the Notes. Please note that certain provisions of the Intercreditor Agreement that are stated as applying generally to all types of liabilities are subject to certain exceptions specified in the Intercreditor Agreement. Accordingly, certain provisions will not apply to these exceptions. Such exceptions include but are not limited to cash cover provided under the Existing Senior Facilities Agreement or any future senior facilities agreements (a “Permitted Senior Facilities Agreement”).

Subsection Title: Liabilities”), (ii) the Trustee, the Security Agent and any other trustee in relation to the Senior Notes and the Senior
Subsubsection Text: The Secured Parties benefit from the transaction security. Subject to certain exceptions and to the order of application of proceeds (see “—Application of proceeds” below), the transaction security shall rank and secure (but only to the extent such transaction security is expressed to secure those liabilities) the liabilities owed to first, the Senior Creditors _pari passu_ and without preference between them and second, the Junior Creditors _pari passu and without preference between them. In addition, the Intercreditor Agreement provides that the guarantees and transaction security will be released in certain circumstances described further below in “—Release of security—Non distressed disposals” and “—Release of _security and guarantees—distressed disposals.”_

Subsection Title: Liabilities”), (ii) the Trustee, the Security Agent and any other trustee in relation to the Senior Notes and the Senior
Subsubsection Text: _Permitted payments in respect of the Senior Debt_ The Debtors and Third Party Security Providers may make payments in respect of the Senior Facility Liabilities and Senior Notes Liabilities (the creditors in respect thereof being the “Senior Debt Creditors”), at any time in accordance with the Existing Senior Facilities Agreement, the Indenture for the Notes and any other Senior Debt Document (as applicable). _Permitted payments in respect of the Junior Debt_ Prior to the date on which the Senior Liabilities have been fully and finally discharged and the Senior Creditors are under no further obligation to provide financial accommodation to any of the Debtors under the Debt Documents (the “Senior Discharge Date”), the Debtors and Third Party Security Providers may make payments in respect of the Junior Liabilities: - if: the payment is of any of the principal amount of the Junior Liabilities in accordance with (in the case of the Junior Facility Liabilities) the terms of the Junior Facility Agreements and (in the case of Junior Note Liabilities) the terms of the Junior Note Documents: i. relating to provisions which are equivalent to illegality, right of cancellation and repayment in relation to a single lender or issuing bank under the Existing Senior Facilities Agreement; ii. non-distressed disposals or mandatory prepayment of proceeds contemplated by the Intercreditor Agreement; ----- iii. (only after the discharge in full of the Senior Debt Liabilities), relating to provisions which are equivalent to the partial prepayment clause relating to excess cashflow of the Existing Senior Facilities Agreement; or iv. any amount of principal or capitalized interest in respect of the Junior Note Liabilities which is not prohibited from being paid by the Senior Finance Documents and the Senior Note Documents; or any other amount which is not an amount of principal or capitalized interest such other amounts including all scheduled interest payments (including, if applicable, special interest (or liquidated damages)) and default interest on the Junior Note Liabilities accrued and payable in cash in accordance with the terms of the relevant Junior Note Documents (as at the date of issue of the same or as amended in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement and the other Debt Documents), additional amounts payable as a result of the tax gross-up provisions relating to the Junior Note Liabilities and amounts in respect of currency indemnities in the Junior Note Indenture; no junior payment stop notice is outstanding; and no payment default in relation to the Senior Liabilities has occurred and is continuing; - if the Majority Senior Creditors (as defined below) give prior consent to that payment being made; - if (a) an event of default has occurred under (in the case of the Junior Facility Liabilities) a Junior Facility Agreement or (in the case of the Junior Note Liabilities) a Junior Note Indenture and is continuing and the payment is (in the case of the Junior Facility Liabilities) of junior restructuring costs or (in the case of the Junior Note Liabilities) of junior note restructuring costs, the common currency amount of which, when aggregated with the common currency amount of any other such amounts paid, does not exceed €2,500,000; and (b) no payment default in relation to the Senior Liabilities has occurred and is continuing; - if the payments are of costs, commissions, taxes and expenses incurred in respect of (or reasonably incidental to) the Junior Note Documents (including in relation to any reporting or listing requirements under the relevant Junior Note Documents); - if the payments are of costs, commissions, taxes and any expenses incurred in respect of (or reasonably incidental to) any refinancing of the Junior Notes in compliance with the Intercreditor Agreement, the Senior Finance Documents and the Senior Note Documents; - if the payments are of Creditor Representative Amounts due and payable to the Junior Note Trustee, or - if the payment is by the Issuer of any of its obligations under a Junior Note Indenture and such payment is not directly or indirectly financed by any member of the Group except to the extent such payment would, if it had been a payment by a Debtor (other than the Issuer) or other member of the Group to a Junior Note Creditor, otherwise have been permitted under the Intercreditor Agreement. On or after the Senior Discharge Date, the Debtors and Third Party Security Providers may make payments to the Junior Creditors in respect of the Junior Liabilities in accordance with the Junior Finance Documents and the Junior Note Documents, as applicable.

Subsection Title: Liabilities”), (ii) the Trustee, the Security Agent and any other trustee in relation to the Senior Notes and the Senior
Subsubsection Text: The enforcement regime set out in this section applies generally subject to certain exceptions. _Instructing Group_ An “Instructing Group” means, subject to certain exceptions as set out in the Intercreditor Agreement, at any time prior to the Senior Discharge Date, the Senior Debt Creditors and the Hedge Counterparties that are owed Senior Hedging Liabilities (together, the “Senior Creditors”) representing more than 50% of the Senior Credit Participations (the “Majority Senior Creditors”). _Enforcement of Transaction Security_ ----- The Security Agent may refrain from enforcing the transaction security unless instructed otherwise by the Instructing Group or, if they are entitled to give enforcement instructions in relation to the transaction security in accordance with the paragraph below, the Majority Junior Creditors. Subject to the transaction security having become enforceable in accordance with its terms, the Instructing Group may give or refrain from giving instructions to the Security Agent to enforce or refrain from enforcing the transaction security as they see fit; or, prior to the Senior Discharge Date, if the Instructing Group has instructed the Security Agent not to enforce or to cease enforcing the transaction security or in the absence of instructions from the Instructing Group, and if, in each case, the Instructing Group has not required any Debtor or Third Party Security Provider to make a Distressed Disposal, the Security Agent shall give effect to any instructions to enforce the transaction security which the Majority Junior Creditors are then entitled to give to the Security Agent in certain circumstances and subject to the lapse of certain time periods where applicable as further specified under the Intercreditor Agreement. _Manner of enforcement_ If the transaction security is being enforced in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement, the Security Agent shall enforce the relevant transaction security in such manner (including, without limitation, the selection of any administrator (or any analogous officer in any jurisdiction) of any Debtor or Third Party Security Provider to be appointed by the Security Agent) as the Instructing Group or any Junior Creditors entitled to give instructions pursuant to the Intercreditor Agreement shall instruct it or, in the absence of any such instructions, as the Security Agent considers in its discretion to be appropriate. The Secured Parties shall not have any independent power to enforce, or have recourse to, any of the transaction security or to exercise any right, power, authority or discretion arising under the Security Documents except through the Security Agent. _Turnover_ Subject to certain exceptions, the Intercreditor Agreement provides that if, at any time prior to the full and final discharge of the Senior Liabilities and Junior Liabilities, any creditor under the Debt Documents receives or recovers from any Debtor, member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider: (a) any payment or distribution of, or on account of or in relation to, any of the liabilities owed to the creditors under the Debt Documents other than any payment or distribution which is either (x) permitted under the Intercreditor Agreement or (y) made in accordance with the provisions set out below under “—Application of proceeds”; (b) except with respect to certain set-off rights, any amount by way of set off which does not give effect to a payment permitted under the Intercreditor Agreement; (c) except with respect to certain set-off rights, any amount: i. on account of, or in relation to, any of the liabilities owed to the creditors under the Debt Documents (A) after the occurrence of an acceleration event or the enforcement of any transaction security (a “Distress Event”), or (B) as a result of any other litigation or proceedings against a member of the Group or a Third Party Security Provider (other than after the occurrence of an Insolvency Event (as defined below) in respect of that member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider); or ii. by way of set off in respect of any such liabilities owed to it after the occurrence of a Distress Event, other than, in each case, any amount received or recovered in accordance with the provisions set out below under “—Application of proceeds”; (d) the proceeds of any enforcement of any of the transaction security except in accordance with the provisions set out below under “—Application of proceeds”; or (e) except with respect to certain set-off rights, any distribution or payment of, or on account of or in relation to, any of the liabilities owed by any member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider which is not in accordance with the provisions set out below under “—Application of proceeds” and which is made as a result of, or after, the occurrence of an Insolvency Event (as defined below) in respect of that member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider, that creditor will: i. in relation to receipts and recoveries not received or recovered by way of set off: ----- 1. hold an amount of that receipt or recovery equal to the relevant liabilities (or, if less, the amount received or recovered) on trust for the Security Agent and promptly pay or distribute that amount to the Security Agent for application in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement, and 2. promptly pay or distribute an amount equal to the amount (if any) by which the receipt or recovery exceeds the relevant liabilities to the Security Agent for application in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement; and ii. in relation to receipts and recoveries received or recovered by way of set off, promptly pay an amount equal to that recovery to the Security Agent for application in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement. “Insolvency Event” includes, in relation to any member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider (a) any resolution is passed or order made for the winding up, dissolution, administration or reorganisation of that member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider, a moratorium is declared in relation to any indebtedness of that member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider or an administrator is appointed to that member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider; (b) any composition, compromise, assignment or arrangement is made with any of its creditors; (c) the appointment of any liquidator, receiver, administrative receiver, administrator, compulsory manager or other similar officer in respect of that member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider or any of its assets; or (d) any analogous procedure or step is taken in any jurisdiction.

Subsection Title: Liabilities”), (ii) the Trustee, the Security Agent and any other trustee in relation to the Senior Notes and the Senior
Subsubsection Text: _Order of application—Transaction Security_ Subject to certain provisions set out in the Intercreditor Agreement and to the provisions described below, all amounts from time to time received or recovered by the Security Agent pursuant to the terms of any Debt Document or in connection with the realization or enforcement of all or any part of the transaction security shall be held by the Security Agent on trust to apply them at any time as the Security Agent (in its discretion) sees fit, in the following order of priority: (a) in discharging any sums owed to the Security Agent (other than pursuant to the parallel debt provisions) and any receiver or delegate and in payment to the Creditor Representatives of the relevant creditor representative amounts; (b) in discharging all costs and expenses incurred by any Senior Creditor or Junior Creditor in connection with any realization or enforcement of the transaction security taken in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement or any action taken at the request of the Security Agent under the Intercreditor Agreement; (c) for application towards the discharge of; i. the Senior Facility Liabilities (in accordance with the terms of the Senior Finance Documents); ii. the Senior Note Liabilities (in accordance with the terms of the Senior Note Documents); and iii. the Senior Hedging Liabilities (on a pro rata basis between the Senior Hedging Liabilities of each Hedge Counterparty); on a pro rata basis between (1), (2) and (3) above; (d) for application towards the discharge of: i. the Junior Facility Liabilities (in accordance with the terms of the Junior Finance Documents); ii. the Junior Note Liabilities (in accordance with the terms of the Junior Note Documents); and iii. the Junior Hedging Liabilities (on a pro rata basis between the Junior Hedging Liabilities of each Hedge Counterparty); on a pro rata basis between (1), (2) and (3) above; (e) if none of the Debtors or, as the case may be, Third Party Security Providers are under any further actual or contingent liability under any Senior Finance Document, Senior Note Document, Hedging Agreement, Junior Finance Document or Junior Note Document, in payment or distribution to any person to whom ----- the Security Agent is obliged to pay or distribute in priority to any Debtor or Third Party Security Provider; and (a) the balance, if any, in payment or distribution to the relevant Debtor or Third Party Security Provider.

Subsection Title: Liabilities”), (ii) the Trustee, the Security Agent and any other trustee in relation to the Senior Notes and the Senior
Subsubsection Text: All the Junior Debt Creditors (acting as a whole), may, after a Distress Event and subject to various conditions set out in the Intercreditor Agreement (including the grant of an acceptable indemnity against clawback to the relevant lenders or creditors and payment in relation to all losses incurred by certain other parties as a consequence of any sum received and a simultaneous transfer of each Hedging Agreement with associated rights and obligations), require the transfer to them (or to a nominee or nominees) of all, but not part, of the rights and obligations in respect of the Senior Debt Liabilities at par plus all costs and expenses (including legal fees) incurred by the Senior Agent, the Senior Lenders, the relevant Senior Note Trustee and the Senior Noteholders as a consequence of giving effect to that transfer.

Subsection Title: Liabilities”), (ii) the Trustee, the Security Agent and any other trustee in relation to the Senior Notes and the Senior
Subsubsection Text: In circumstances where an asset of a member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider or an asset subject to transaction security is to be disposed of to a person (or persons) outside the Group and which is not a Third Party Security Provider and the Security Agent is notified that such disposal is permitted under the Senior Finance Documents, Senior Note Documents, Junior Finance Documents and Junior Note Documents and that such disposal is not a distressed disposal, the Intercreditor Agreement provides that the Security Agent is irrevocably authorized: - to release the transaction security or any other claim (relating to a Debt Document) over that asset; - where that asset consists of shares in the capital of a member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider, to release the transaction security or any other claim (relating to a Debt Document) over that member of the Group’s or Third Party Security Provider’s property; and - to execute and deliver or enter into any release of the transaction security or any claim described in the before mentioned paragraphs and issue any certificates of non-crystallization of any floating charge or any consent to dealing that may, in the discretion of the Security Agent, be considered necessary or desirable.

Subsection Title: Liabilities”), (ii) the Trustee, the Security Agent and any other trustee in relation to the Senior Notes and the Senior
Subsubsection Title: Release of security and guarantees—distressed disposals
Subsubsection Text: In circumstances where an appropriation or a disposal of an asset of a member of the Group or a Third Party Security Provider is being effected (x) at the request of the Instructing Group in circumstances where the transaction security has become enforceable, (y) by enforcement of the transaction security or (z) after the occurrence of a Distress Event to a person or persons which is, or are, not a member, or members, of the Group (a “Distressed Disposal”), the Intercreditor Agreement provides, subject to certain conditions, that the Security Agent is irrevocably authorized: - to release the transaction security or any other claim over the asset subject to the Distressed Disposal or appropriation and execute and deliver or enter into any release of that transaction security or claim and issue any letters of non-crystallization of any floating charge or any consent to dealing that may, in the discretion of the Security Agent, be considered necessary or desirable; - if the asset that is disposed of or appropriated consists of shares in the capital of a Debtor or Third Party Security Provider, to release (i) that Debtor or Third Party Security Provider and any subsidiary of that Debtor or Third Party Security Provider from all or any part of its borrowing liabilities, guarantee liabilities and certain other liabilities; (ii) any transaction security granted by that Debtor or Third Party Security Provider or any subsidiary of that Debtor or Third Party Security Provider over any of its assets; and (iii) any other claim of an Intra-Group Lender, or another Debtor or another Third Party Security Provider over that Debtor’s or Third Party Security Provider’s assets or over the assets of any Subsidiary of that Debtor or Third Party Security Provider; - if the asset that is disposed of or appropriated consists of shares in the capital of any holding company of a Debtor, to release (i) that holding company and any subsidiary of that holding company from all or any part of its borrowing liabilities, guarantee liabilities and certain other liabilities, (ii) any transaction security granted by any subsidiary of that holding company over any of its assets, and (iii) any other claim of an Intra-Group Lender or another Debtor over the assets of any subsidiary of that holding company; ----- - if the asset which is disposed of or appropriated consists of shares in the capital of a Debtor or any holding company of a Debtor, to dispose of (i) all or any part of the Liabilities (other than liabilities due to the Senior Agent, Senior Arrangers or any Senior Note Trustee), or (ii) intra-group receivables provided that the transferee shall not be treated as a Senior Creditor, a Junior Creditor or a Secured Party under the Intercreditor Agreement; - if the asset which is disposed of or appropriated consists of shares in the capital of a Debtor or any holding company of a Debtor, to dispose of (i) the Liabilities (other than liabilities due to any Senior Agent, Senior Arrangers or any Senior Note Trustee), or (ii) intra-group receivables, where the transferee of such Liabilities shall become a Senior Creditor, a Junior Creditor or Secured Party provided that such transfer is in respect of all (and not part only) of such Liabilities and/or intra-group receivables, as appliable; and - if the asset which is disposed of or appropriated consists of shares in the capital of a Debtor or any holding company of a Debtor, to transfer Intra-Group Liabilities or intra-group receivables owed by that Debtor or holding company of a Debtor to another Debtor. Any net proceeds of the disposal must be applied in accordance with the enforcement proceeds waterfall described under “—Application of proceeds.”

Subsection Title: Liabilities”), (ii) the Trustee, the Security Agent and any other trustee in relation to the Senior Notes and the Senior
Subsubsection Text: If any Intra-Group Lender or any member of the Group or Third Party Security Provider makes any loan to or grants any credit to or makes any other financial arrangement having similar effect with any Debtor, in an aggregate amount of €3,000,000 or more, the Issuer will procure that the person giving that loan, granting that credit or making that other financial arrangement (if not already a party as an Intra-Group Lender) accedes to the Intercreditor Agreement as an IntraGroup Lender.

Subsection Title: Liabilities”), (ii) the Trustee, the Security Agent and any other trustee in relation to the Senior Notes and the Senior
Subsubsection Text: The Intercreditor Agreement provides that, subject to certain exceptions, its terms may be amended or waived only with the consent of the facility agents, the Majority Senior Lenders, the Majority Senior Noteholders, the Majority Junior Lenders, the Majority Junior Noteholders and the Security Agent. However, to the extent that an amendment, waiver or consent in relation to certain equalisation provisions does not affect the Junior Creditors, those provisions of the Intercreditor Agreement may be amended or waived, subject to certain exceptions, with the consent of the senior agent, the Majority Senior Lenders, the Majority Senior Noteholders and the Security Agent. An amendment or waiver of the Intercreditor Agreement that has the effect of changing or which relates to, among other matters, the provisions set out under “—Application of proceeds” above and the order of priority or subordination under the Intercreditor Agreement shall not be made without the consent of each of the Facility Agents, the Senior Lenders, each Senior Note Trustee on behalf of the Senior Noteholders in respect of which it is the Creditor Representative, the Junior Lenders, each Junior Note Trustee on behalf of the Junior Noteholders in respect of which it is the Creditor Representative, each Hedge Counterparty (to the extent that the amendment or waiver would adversely affect the Hedge Counterparty) and the Security Agent. The Intercreditor Agreement includes provisions which can result in a party’s participation being deemed to be zero for the purpose of calculating the percentage of necessary consents by the members of a relevant group in regard to amendments and waivers if that party fails to respond to that request within ten business days of that consent request being made or (in the case of a Senior Creditor, in relation to certain requests) fails to provide details of its participations to the Security Agent within the period specified by the Security Agent.. The Intercreditor Agreement also permits (or in some cases, requires) the Security Agent (subject to the terms of any credit facility) to enter into new or supplemental security if certain conditions are met, including in connection with uncommitted facilities established under the Existing Senior Facilities Agreement.

Subsection Title: Liabilities”), (ii) the Trustee, the Security Agent and any other trustee in relation to the Senior Notes and the Senior
Subsubsection Text: The Intercreditor Agreement and any non-contractual obligations arising out of or in connection with it are governed by English law. -----

Subsection Title: Liabilities”), (ii) the Trustee, the Security Agent and any other trustee in relation to the Senior Notes and the Senior
Subsubsection Text: Noteholders (the “Senior Notes Liabilities”) and (iii) the hedge counterparties under or in connection with the hedging agreements relating to Senior Facility Liabilities and Senior Notes Liabilities (the “Senior Hedging Liabilities”) _pari _passu and without any preference between them. The Senior Facility Liabilities, the Senior Notes Liabilities and the Senior_ Hedging Liabilities are together the “Senior Liabilities” and the creditors thereunder the “Senior Creditors” and _second, (i) the agents, the arrangers, the lenders, the issuing banks, the ancillary lenders and the security agent_ each in its capacity as creditor or as applicable creditor in respect of the parallel debt obligations in relation to liabilities ----- under the Junior Finance Documents (the “Junior Facility Liabilities”), (ii) the trustee(s) in relation to any Junior Notes, the Security Agent and the Junior Noteholders (the “Junior Notes Liabilities”) and (iii) the hedge counterparties under or in connection with the hedging agreements relating to Junior Facility Liabilities and Junior Notes Liabilities (the “Junior Hedging Liabilities”)** _pari passu and without any preference between them. The Junior Facility Liabilities, the Junior Notes Liabilities and the Junior Hedging Liabilities are together the “Junior Liabilities” and the creditors thereunder the “Junior Creditors”. The Intercreditor Agreement provides that the intra-group liabilities owed by one member of the Group to another member of the Group (other than any Shareholder Liabilities (as defined below)) (the “Intra-Group Liabilities”) will be postponed and subordinated to the liabilities owed by the Debtors and Third Party Security Providers to the creditors under the Senior Liabilities and Junior Liabilities, (together with the relevant creditor representatives, the Security Agent and any receiver or delegate, the “Secured Parties”). The Intercreditor Agreement further provides that the liabilities (“Shareholder Liabilities”) owed by any member of the Group to a direct or indirect shareholder of the Issuer or any subsidiary of such (direct or indirect shareholder) of the Issuer which is not a member of the Group under any loan made by it to the Issuer or any other member of the Group will be postponed and subordinated to the liabilities owed by the Debtors and Third Party Security Providers to the Secured Parties. The Intercreditor Agreement does not purport to rank any of the Intra-Group Liabilities or the Shareholder Liabilities as between themselves.

In June 2023, the Group entered into the Trade Receivables Purchase Program pursuant to which the Group sells a portion of its accounts receivables from operating businesses in certain jurisdictions in return for funding. Receivables are only eligible for sale if they meet certain criteria. As at June 30, 2023, €48.1 million in financing was outstanding under the Trade Receivable Purchase Program (which may be increased to €75 million as permitted under the Trade Receivables Purchase Program). The Trade Receivables Purchase Program is currently expected to be secured on a first priority basis by certain collection accounts for trade receivables in Belgium, Germany and the Netherlands, that will not secure the Notes. For further detail, see Note 4 of the HY 2023 Interim Financial Statements. -----

_Set forth below is a summary of certain of our future significant debt arrangements. The following summary does not purport to be complete and is subject to, and qualified in its entirety by reference to, the underlying documents. The defined terms set forth in this section apply to this section only._

Subsection Title: Brief Description of the Structure and Ranking of the Notes and the Guarantees
Subsubsection Text: The Notes will: - be the Issuer's general, senior obligations; - be secured as set forth under "—Security," on a pari passu basis with the interests granted in favor of the Existing Senior Facilities and certain hedging obligations; - rank pari passu in right of payment with any existing and future obligations of the Issuer that are not expressly subordinated in right of payment to the Notes, including the Issuer's obligations under the Existing Senior Facilities; ----- - rank senior in right of payment to any existing and future obligations of the Issuer that are expressly subordinated in right of payment to the Notes; - be effectively senior to any existing and future obligations of the Issuer that are not secured by the Collateral, to the extent of the value of such Collateral; - be effectively subordinated to any existing or future obligations of the Issuer and its subsidiaries that are secured by property or assets that do not secure the Notes, to the extent of the value of the property or assets securing such obligations; - be structurally subordinated to any existing or future obligations of the subsidiaries of the Issuer that are not Guarantors, including obligations owed to trade creditors; and - be guaranteed on a senior joint and several basis by the Guarantors.

Subsection Title: Brief Description of the Structure and Ranking of the Notes and the Guarantees
Subsubsection Text: The Notes will initially be guaranteed, as of the Issue Date, by the Initial Guarantors. Each Guarantee of a Guarantor will: - be a general senior obligation of such Guarantor; - be secured as set forth under "—Security," on a pari passu basis with the interests granted in favor of the Existing Senior Facilities and certain hedging obligations; - rank pari passu in right of payment with any existing and future obligations of the relevant Guarantor that are not expressly subordinated in right of payment to such Guarantee, including such Guarantor's obligations under the Existing Senior Facilities; - rank senior in right of payment to any existing and future obligations of such Guarantor that are expressly subordinated in right of payment to such Guarantee; - be effectively senior to any existing and future obligations of the applicable Guarantor that are not secured by the Collateral owned by such Guarantor, to the extent of the value of such Collateral; - be effectively subordinated to any existing or future obligations of such Guarantor that are secured by property or assets that do not secure such Guarantee to the extent of the value of the property or assets securing such other obligations; - be structurally subordinated to any existing or future obligations of the subsidiaries of such Guarantor that do not provide Guarantees, including obligations owed to trade creditors; and - be subject to the limitations described herein and in "Risk Factors—Risks Related to the Notes, the _Guarantees and Our Structure—Each Guarantee and security interest will be subject to certain limitations on enforcement and may be limited by applicable law or subject to certain defenses that may limit its validity and enforceability" and "Limitations on Validity and Enforceability of the Security and the Guarantees and Certain Insolvency Law Considerations."_

Subsection Title: Brief Description of the Structure and Ranking of the Notes and the Guarantees
Subsubsection Text: The Issuer is partially dependent upon cash flows from its subsidiaries to meet its obligations under the Notes. See "Risk Factors—Risks Related to the Notes, the Guarantees and Our Structure—The Issuer depends upon cash flow _from subsidiaries to meet its obligations on the Notes and the Guarantees."_ Not all of the Issuer's direct and indirect Subsidiaries will guarantee the Notes. As of and for the year ended December 31, 2022, the Issuer and the Guarantors represented 87% of our Reported EBITDA (excluding entities with negative Reported EBITDA), 89% of our revenue and 92% of our total assets (including goodwill). The Notes are effectively subordinated in right of payment to all Debt and other liabilities and commitments (including trade payables and lease obligations) of the Issuer's Subsidiaries that are not Guarantors. Any right of the Issuer to receive assets of any of its Subsidiaries upon the Subsidiary's liquidation or reorganization (and the consequent right of ----- the Holders to participate in those assets) will be effectively subordinated to the claims of that Subsidiary's creditors, except to the extent that the Issuer is itself recognized as a creditor of the Subsidiary, in which case the claims of the Issuer would still be subordinated in right of payment to any security over the assets of the Subsidiary and any Debt of the Subsidiary senior to that held by the Issuer. The obligations of a Guarantor under its Guarantee will be limited as necessary to prevent the relevant Guarantee from constituting a fraudulent conveyance or unlawful financial assistance or infringement of capital maintenance rules under applicable law, otherwise to reflect limitations under applicable law or as set out in the respective Guarantee. By virtue of these limitations, a Guarantor's obligation under its Guarantee could be significantly less than amounts payable with respect to the Notes, or a Guarantor may have effectively no obligation under its Guarantee. See "Risk Factors—Risks _Related to the Notes, the Guarantees and Our Structure—Each Guarantee and security interest will be subject to certain limitations on enforcement and may be limited by applicable law or subject to certain defenses that may limit its validity and enforceability." The validity and enforceability of the Guarantees and the liability of each Guarantor will be subject to_ the limitations described in this Offering Memorandum under the caption "Limitations on Validity and Enforceability of _the Security and the Guarantees and Certain Insolvency Law Considerations."_ As of the Issue Date, all of the Issuer's Subsidiaries will be "Restricted Subsidiaries." Under the circumstances described below under "—Certain Covenants—Designation of Unrestricted and Restricted Subsidiaries," the Issuer will be permitted to designate certain of its Subsidiaries as "Unrestricted Subsidiaries." Unrestricted Subsidiaries of the Issuer will not be subject to the restrictive covenants in the Indenture. Further, Unrestricted Subsidiaries of the Issuer will not Guarantee the Notes. Although the Indenture will contain limitations on the amount of additional Debt that the Issuer, the Guarantors and the Restricted Subsidiaries may incur, the amount of such additional Debt could be substantial. The Indenture will permit additional Debt to be secured.

The Notes will mature on     , 2029 unless redeemed prior thereto as described herein. The Issuer will issue the Notes in the aggregate principal amount of €400,000,000. Each Note will bear interest at a rate per annum of      % and interest will be payable semi-annually on      and      of each year, commencing on     , 2024. Interest will be payable to Holders of record on each Note in respect of the principal amount thereof outstanding as at the Clearing System Business Day immediately preceding the payment date, as the case may be; however, owners of beneficial interests in the Notes must rely on the procedures of Euroclear or Clearstream, as applicable. See "Risk Factors—Risks Related to the _Notes, the Guarantees and Our Structure—The Notes will initially be held in book-entry form, and therefore you must rely on the procedures of the relevant clearing systems to exercise any rights and remedies." If the due date for any payment in_ respect of the Notes is not a Business Day or a business day at the place at which such payment is due to be paid, the Holder thereof will not be entitled to payment of the amount due until the next succeeding Business Day at such place, and will not be entitled to any further interest or other payment as a result of any such delay. The rights of Holders in beneficial interest of the Notes to receive the payments on such Notes are subject to applicable procedures of Euroclear and/or Clearstream. Interest on the Notes will accrue from, and including, the original issuance date or, if interest has already been paid, from the date it was most recently paid. Interest will be computed on the basis of a 360-day year comprised of twelve 30-day months on the aggregate nominal amount outstanding.

The Notes will be issued only in fully registered form without coupons and only in denominations of €100,000 and integral multiples of €1,000 in excess thereof. Notes sold within the United States to qualified institutional buyers pursuant to Rule 144A under the U.S. Securities Act ("Rule 144A") will initially be represented by one or more global Notes in registered form without interest coupons attached (the "144A Global Notes"), and Notes sold outside the United States pursuant to Regulation S under the U.S. Securities Act ("Regulation S") will initially be represented by one or more global Notes in registered form without interest coupons attached (the "Regulation S Global Notes" and, together with the 144A Global Notes, the "Global

The Global Notes will be deposited with a common depositary for Euroclear and Clearstream and registered in the name of the nominee of such common depositary. Ownership of interests in the Global Notes, referred to in this description as "book-entry interests," will be limited to persons that have accounts with Euroclear or Clearstream or their respective participants. ----- The terms of the Indenture will provide for the issuance of Definitive Registered Notes in certain limited circumstances. See "Book-Entry; Delivery and Form."

The Notes will be subject to certain restrictions on transfer and certification requirements, as described under "Notice to Investors." A Holder may transfer or exchange Notes in accordance with the Indenture and the procedures of Euroclear and Clearstream. Upon any transfer or exchange, the Issuer, the Agents and/or the Trustee may require a Holder, among other things, to furnish appropriate endorsements and transfer documents and the Issuer may require a Holder to pay any taxes or other governmental charges payable in connection with the transfer or exchange. The Issuer will not be required to transfer or exchange any Note selected for redemption or repurchase or to transfer or exchange any Note for a period of 15 Business Days prior to any date on which all or any part of the Notes are to be redeemed or repurchased. The Notes will be issued in registered form and the Holder will be treated as the owner of such Note for all purposes. For further information about transfer and exchange procedures, see the section titled "Book-Entry; Delivery and Form." Book-entry interests in the 144A Global Notes may be transferred to a person who takes delivery in the form of book-entry interests in the Regulation S Global Note only upon delivery by the transferor of a written certification (in the form provided in the Indenture) to the effect that such transfer is being made in accordance with Regulation S. Book-entry interests in the Regulation S Global Notes may be transferred to a person who takes delivery in the form of book-entry interests in the 144A Global Note only upon delivery by the transferor of a written certification (in the form provided in the Indenture) to the effect that such transfer is being made to a person who the transferor reasonably believes is a "qualified institutional buyer" within the meaning of Rule 144A) in a transaction meeting the requirements of Rule 144A. Any book-entry interest that is transferred as described in the immediately preceding paragraphs will, upon transfer, cease to be a book-entry interest in the Global Note from which it was transferred and will become a book-entry interest in the Global Note to which it was transferred. Accordingly, from and after such transfer, it will become subject to all transfer restrictions, if any, and other procedures applicable to book-entry interests in the Global Note to which it was transferred. All transfers of book-entry interests between participants in Euroclear or Clearstream will be effected by Euroclear or Clearstream pursuant to customary procedures and subject to applicable rules and procedures established by Euroclear or Clearstream and their respective participants. See "Book-Entry; Delivery and Form."

Subsection Title: Payments on the Notes; Paying Agent, Transfer Agent and Registrar
Subsubsection Text: The Issuer will make all payments, including principal of, premium, if any, and interest on the Notes, at its office or through its agent that it will maintain for these purposes. Initially, that agent will be The Bank of New York Mellon, London Branch (the "Paying Agent"). The Issuer may change the Paying Agent without prior notice to the Holders. The Issuer will make all payments in same-day funds. The Issuer will also maintain a registrar (the "Registrar") and a transfer agent (the "Transfer Agent"). The initial Registrar and the initial Transfer Agent will be The Bank of New York Mellon SA/NV, Dublin Branch. The Registrar will maintain a register reflecting ownership of the Notes outstanding from time to time, if any, and together with the Transfer Agent, will facilitate transfers of the Notes on behalf of the Issuer. A register of the Notes shall be left at the registered office of the Issuer. In case of inconsistency between the register of Notes kept by the Registrar and the one kept by the Issuer at its registered office, the register kept by the Issuer shall prevail. The Registrar has no responsibility for any register maintained by the Issuer. The Issuer may change any Paying Agent, Registrar or Transfer Agent for the Notes without prior notice to the Holders of such Notes. However, for so long as they are admitted to trading on the Official List of the Exchange and the rules and regulations of the Authority so require, the Issuer will publish a notice of any change of Paying Agent, Registrar or Transfer Agent to the extent and in the manner permitted by such rules and regulations. In addition, for so long as any Notes are represented by Global Notes, such notices to Holders of the Notes may be delivered by or on behalf of the Issuer to Euroclear and Clearstream. ----- Holders will not be responsible for any service charge for any registration of transfer, exchange or redemption of the Notes, but the Issuer may require payment of a sum sufficient to cover any transfer tax or similar governmental charge payable in connection with any such registration of transfer or exchange.

From time to time, subject to the Issuer's compliance with the covenants described under the headings "—Certain _Covenants—Limitation on Debt" and "—Certain Covenants—Limitation on Liens," the Issuer is permitted to issue_ additional Notes ("Additional Notes"), which shall have the terms set out in an Officer's Certificate supplied to the Trustee. The Notes (together with any Additional Notes of such series issued from time to time) will constitute separate series of Notes, but will be treated, along with all other series of Notes, as a single class for the purposes of the Indenture with respect to waivers, amendments and all other matters which are not specifically distinguished for such series.
